item.description:
My quest on the Appalachian Trail continues. I have planned a two day, overnight event for, yes, Monday/Tuesday. Some of us have the pleasure of summers off.

This will be a 21 mile thru hike from Dalton Mass to I-90/Mass Pike. The first day we will meet at the parking area on Jacobs Ladder Highway (rt.20) near the Mass Pike, exit 2 in Lee at 8:00 a.m. From there we will take a vehical to the starting spot on Gulf Rd in Dalton Mass. I hope to be on the trail by 9:00 a.m.

The first day will be a bit pushy on mileage. We are going to hike to the October Mtn. lean to. This will make for a 13 mile day. We will head over Day Mtn, Tully Mtn and Warner Hill. We will over night at the lean to. Day two we will finish the 8 mile section that will lead back to the car and the Mass Pike. Obviously we then have to get back to the car in Dalton.

I do not have a time frames for the time we will finish. There are too many variables that include what time we break camp on Tuesday.

Please email me any questions about this event.

This the hike starting place that we will shuttle to:
http://www.mapquest.c...

Now, this is where we are meeting. There is a parking area on Rt. 20 before Greenwater Pond. Take the Mass Pike to Lee MA, exit 2. Then take Rt. 20 east to the parking area that is in between rt.20 and the Mass Pike.
http://www.mapquest.c...

== ADVISED MUST-BRING GEAR/SUPPLIES ==
* Full pack
* Waterproofed hiking boots -Must be comfortable, & broken in
* Wool socks
* Layers of cloathing -Avoid cotton as it stays wet. Plus second day's clothing.
* Hat
* Rain parka/jacket -just in case
* Sleeping bag
* Light bedcloaths -(Shorts, Tee) To deal with heat/humidity
* Headlamp -LED version best
* Backpacking tent -Or share
* 3 quarts water -No defined safe water source except campsite
* 4 meals for on the trail -DAY-1: lunch, supper; DAY-2: breakfast, lunch (all trash to be packed out!). High energy meals should be planned. Only supper may be cooked but if getting up early (6:00 AM) then breakfast can be cooked too.
* Trail appropriate high energy snacks -e.g. at least G.O.R.P (Good Old Raisins and Peanuts), beef jerky, granola bars, etc.
* Sunscreen
* Bugspray -Essential!
* Emergency whistle
* Bear bag and 15' min. light weight rope -Hang food at night

== OPTIONAL GEAR ==
* Water filter -To restock water
* Compass
* Camera and extra batteries
* Pocket knife
* Backpacking first aid kit -For blisters and such
* Waterproof matches -For cooking, campfire, emergency fire (warm up, signal)
* Mess kit -If needed
* Camping utensils -If needed
* Backpacking stove and fuel -If cooking
